result.execSummary:
The defendant Trevor J Ahrens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).
  • Strangulation and Suffocation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • False Imprisonment, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
On Count #1: The Court sentences Mr. Ahrens to 40 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 20 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 20 years.  This sentence is to commence FORTHWITH

**Defendant entered "No Contest" pleas on 1/9/2018 and was found criminally responsible at Jury trial on 1/18/18.**

--to pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge

--to pay $159 in subpoena fees
--if Mr. Ahrens is employed, any employment must be one where he is amongst other persons

--no direct or indirect contact with Melissa Henrichon or her immediate family

--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription to include psychotropic medications

--not to possess or consume any alcohol

--to undergo assessment, counseling or therapy as required by the Agent

--take all prescription medications as prescribed

--Court recommends that the Agent evaluate ongoing contact with mother, Anita Ahrens

--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand

records.addlTxt:
[MA]Case called at 2:31pm
Defendant Trevor J Ahrens in court, in custody with Attorney Karl E Huebner.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court notes that It has reviewed 2/1/18 letter purportedly from Mr. Ahrens and jail recordings submitted by the State, where Mrs. Ahrens dictates the letter for Mr. Ahrens; the Court will not take letter as a motion to withdraw pleas

DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance, notes that victim is present and wishes to make a statement, also submits a written victim impact statement  

Sentencing arguments given by DA Happ
Statement made by Victim
Sentencing arguments given by Atty. Huebner
Statement made by Mr. Ahrens

On Count #1: The Court sentences Mr. Ahrens   to  40  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  20  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 20  years.  This sentence is to commence FORTHWITH

On Count #2: The Court sentences Mr. Ahrens   to  6  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  3  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3  years.  This sentence is to be served concurrent to Count #1

On Count #3: The Court sentences Mr. Ahrens   to  3  years and 6 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1  year 6 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2  years.  This sentence is to be served concurrent to Counts #1 and #2

On Count #4: The Court sentences Mr. Ahrens   to  6  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  3  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3  years.  This sentence is to be served concurrent to Counts #1, #2 and #3

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives   731  days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to pay restitution to Melissa Henrichon in the amount of $5638.20, unless it is determined that the hospital bill was paid by insurance, then the amount of the hospital bill is to be paid to the insurance company
--no direct or indirect contact with Melissa Henrichon or her immediate family
--to undergo assessment, counseling or therapy as required by the Agent
--take all prescription medications as prescribed
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription to include psychotropic medications
--not to possess or consume any alcohol
--Court recommends that the Agent evaluate ongoing contact with mother, Anita Ahrens
--if Mr. Ahrens is employed, any employment must be one where he is amongst other persons
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge
--to pay $159 in subpoena fees

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Statute 941.291 body armor prohibition imposed; penalties recited
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess: 4:00pm
2 DISCS SUBMITTED WITH STATES 2/5/18 LETTER (CDS CONTAINING CALLS BETWEEN DEFENDNAT & HIS MOTHER)  ( NOT RETAINED ELECTRONICALLY DUE TO FORMAT)
State's Letter to the Court submitted w/DVD of recorded jail calls.
Letter from the Defendant regarding his plea
Sentencing hearing on February 7, 2018 at 02:30 pm.

--cross examination by Attorney Huebner

Detective Lisa Hefty-- sworn and testifies

Closing arguments given by Attorney Huebner  (10:49am-11:11am)

Atty. Huebner requests a PSI be conducted and sentencing be scheduled for a later date.
The Court inquires of Atty. Huebner what additional information would be learned from a PSI.
Atty. Huebner is to notify the Court by 1/24/18 of additional information that can be obtained from a PSI being conducted, the Court will reschedule sentencing as/if needed. 

recess: 1:43pm

--State's Exhibit #22, #23, #24, #25(Photo of Daily Union Stairway/ Bathroom Doorway)
--State's Exhibit #20(Layout of Daily Union drawn by Detective Hefty)

State's Exhibits #18 -- #25 are offered and received 

--State's Exhibit #39(Booking Room Video)played to Jury; offered & received

Jury Exits at: 4:15pm
Recess at: 4:16pm--Reconvene: 4:27pm. Jury Enters.

--direct examination by DA Happ
--State's Exh. #40, #41-offered and received

recess 5:47pm.
Copy of recording of Visitation between Defendant & his Mother. Submitted on 1/16/18 to go with State's 1/15/18 Letter (NOT ELECTRONICALLY RETAINED)

[MK] case called at 12:47pm. 
Defendant Trevor J Ahrens in court, in custody, with Attorney Karl E Huebner.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
[The Court has scheduled this hearing regarding the DA's notification related to jail recordings and also on Mr. Ahren's 1/15/18 letter requesting new counsel.] 
Attorney Huebner reports that he met with Mr. Ahrens for approximately one hour yesterday; during this meeting Mr. Ahrens never said that he wanted a different attorney. 
DA Happ requests exclusion of the Defendant's mother from the courtroom during the entirety of the trial. DA Happ argues in support of this request.  Attorney Huebner indicates that Mr. Ahrens does not want his mother excluded from the trial.  

The Court excludes Anita Ahrens from the trial; she will not be allowed to be present in the courtroom during the trial. The Court clarifies that Ms. Ahrens is excluded from the courtroom during the trial, but not from the Courthouse.  The Court indicates that Anita Ahrens is not to have contact with Trevor Ahrens during the course of the trial as a means of protecting the integrity of the process.  As with others besides counsel, there is not to be any discussion of the case by anyone with the trial witnesses, and there is not to be any contact with jurors.  
The Court indicates to Mr. Ahrens that he is not to take any action to undermine the trial. 
The Court denies the latest request of Mr. Ahrens to have different counsel. 
Counsel confirm that they are prepared to proceed to trial. However Attorney Huebner voices concern about competency, indicating that he has concern that Mr. Ahrens may not be able to assist in his own defense if Mr. Ahrens does not communicate with him.  
The Court denies the competency-related motion.
 recess 1:07pm. 

NEXT:  the Jury Trial remains on the calendar to commence tomorrow morning
from Defendant requesting Attorney Huebner be dismissed
Letter to Court Regarding Jail Recording  & attachment to Letter from DA Happ re: Jail Recordings (DVD-R submitted on 1/16/18. sf)
from Dr. Berney regarding review of Dr. Schoenecker and Dr. Freiburgers reports as well as video of initial interview of Mr. Ahrens
Court's response to 1/9/18 letter from Atty Huebner
Defense Letter to Court regarding start date of Trial.

[MA]Case called at 10:10am
Defendant Trevor J Ahrens in court, in custody with Attorney Karl E Huebner.  Susan Victoria Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court re-addresses the recusal request and motion to adjourn trial

The Court reads Mr. Ahrens letter dated 1/5/18.

The Court reviews statutes on conflicts between the Court and Counsel 
--upon further contemplation of the issue, the Court is not recusing. 

Atty. Huebner indicates that Mr. Ahrens no longer wants to proceed with any suppression motions

Atty. Huebner indicates that Mr. Ahrens wishes to plea to charges, and have trial on NGI portion.

The Court has discussion with Mr. Ahrens regarding request for new counsel; input from Atty. Huebner and DA Happ
--the Court believes that Mr. Ahrens is knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently withdrawing his request for new counsel

As to Mr. Ahrens request to Miranda/Goodchild hearing:
--DA Happ summarizes what would/will be offered by the State
--Atty. Huebner does not believe a Miranda/Goodchild motion/hearing is necessary after review of record
--Mr. Ahrens agrees that his statements were made voluntarily
--all parties, including Mr. Ahrens agree there is no need for a Miranda/Goodchild hearing


Upon inquiry by the Court, Mr. Ahrens confirms he wishes to plead to the charges and have a trial on the NGI portion.

The Court recites that maximum penalties
The Court reviews with Mr. Ahrens his constitutional rights, including his right to jury trial
Plea Colloquy given by Court
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance

On Count #1: Mr. Ahrens enters a plea of " NO CONTEST"
On Count #2: Mr. Ahrens enters a plea of "NO CONTEST"
On Count #3: Mr. Ahrens enters a plea of "NO CONTEST"
On Count #4: Mr. Ahrens enters a plea of "NO CONTEST"

Factual basis is stipulated

The Court accepts Mr. Ahrens pleas, finds that he has knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently entered the pleas.

The Court finds Mr. Ahrens guilty of all charges, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court indicates that there remains the NGI component, which is scheduled for Jury Trial next week.

The Court and Counsel discuss issues related to trial.
--Motions in Limine will not be addressed at this time, rather at trial if they present themselves
--5 strikes
--1 alternate
--23 seated up front; requires atleast 50 potential jurors present in the courtroom
--counsel to be in courtroom at 8:15 to discuss preliminary matters
--2 days

recess: 11:14am
Notice of Intent to Admit Statements Made by the Defendant
from Dr. Berney responding to Court's 1/3/18 Letter
Copy of email from Dr. Freiburger to the Court's JA
from the Court to Attorney Happ regarding Defendant's request for new counsel
Letter to Judge Weston from Defendant re 1/4/18 hearing

[MA]Case called at 11:03am
Defendant Trevor J Ahrens in court, in custody with Attorney Karl E Huebner.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Huebner indicates that Mr. Ahrens is requesting new counsel; further that Atty. Huebner has consulted with Public Defenders office and are willing to appoint successor counsel

Atty. Huebner summarizes a letter written by Mr. Ahrens giving reasoning for request 

Atty. Huebner orally requests to be withdrawn as attorney. 
--DA Happ argues against request

The Court denies motion, does not allow Atty. Huebner to withdraw as attorney; gives reasoning. 

Counsel verify that all doctors are prepared for trial

The Court maintains currently scheduled trial; will be trial on both the underlying case and NGI component.
recess: 11:11am
Court's letter to Dr. Berney and Dr. Freiburger.
Letter from the Court to Counsel regarding doctors preparedness for trial and their review of the other doctors reports

[MA]Case called at 9:32am
Defendant Trevor J Ahrens in court, in custody with Attorney Karl E Huebner.  Monica J. Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Huebner raises competency; gives reasoning.

The Court questions Mr. Ahrens

The Court does not find Mr Ahrens to be incompetent and is not ordering a competency evaluation
recess: 9:41am--reconvene: 10:17am
Atty. Huebner indicates that Mr. Ahrens' mother has approached him and wishes to have a private attorney determine whether it is in Mr. Ahrens' best interest to enter a plea as intended.

The Court puts counsel on notice that there may be an extraneous factor that will need to be included in jury instructions.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling. 

The Court maintains the FSSC and Jury Trial dates. 
recess: 10:23am

NEXT: Hearing on 1/4/18 at 11:00--noon (plea)

[MA]Case called at 2:30pm
Defendant Trevor J Ahrens in court, in custody with Attorney Karl E Huebner.  Susan Victoria Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court and Counsel discuss Atty. Huebner's letter & Mr. Ahren's request that the Court recuse due to potential conflict
--The Court denies the motion to recuse; gives reasoning

State's Other Acts Motion:
--Defense is not opposed
--The Court makes findings; grants motion

Atty. Huebner indicates that intends to withdraw 'not guilty by reason of mental disease/defect' portion of the plea.
After inquiry with DA Happ, Atty. Huebner indicates that he will need additional time to prepare plea paperwork with Mr. Ahrens.

The Court schedules hearing for next week. 

recess: 2:48pm
NEXT: Hearing on 12/29/18 at 9:00am
Motion hearing on December 22, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

[MA]Case called at 8:35am
Defendant Trevor J Ahrens in court, in custody with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Mr. Ahrens' 6/13/17 Letter:
--Atty. De La Rosa moves to withdraw from Mr. Ahrens' case, indicates successor counsel will be appointed quickly

[MK] case called at 2:38pm. 
Defendant Trevor J Ahrens in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney De La Rosa indicates that a conclusion has been reached that the Defense is not going to request a third examination. 
Counsel estimate needing a three day trial length.   
The Court requires that counsel to inform the Court, within two weeks, of any witness schedule-conflicts regarding the trial dates being scheduled today.  The Court informs counsel that any adjournment of the trial dates being set will result in the case being scheduled before Judge Weston, who will be assigned the case after July 31st.
The Court directs counsel to contact the JA if any intended motions need to be heard before the FSSC date or need a lengthier time, or to have the motions heard on the June 23rd date.
recess 2:46 pm.  
[Post-Hearing/Off-Record the Court requested that Attorney De La Rosa discuss with Mr. Ahrens that the FSSC date is the final opportunity for any case resolution, and Attorney De La Rosa indicated that he would do so.] 
[
NEXT:  (1) FSSC and Motion Hearing on June  23rd at 8:30am, allow two hours,  (2) three day length Jury Trial on July 10th,11th,12th at 8:30am  (JA- a specialized scheduling order is to be issued with these trial date notices)
Status conference on March 27, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

[MA]Case called at 3:07pm 
Defendant Trevor J Ahrens in court, in custody with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.  Monica J. Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsel verify receipt of Dr. Freiburger's Report

Status conference on February 23, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

[MK] case called at 9:14am. 
Defendant Trevor J Ahrens in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa.  DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
This hearing was scheduled after the State requested a supplemental examination; the Court is awaiting the report of the appointed examiner, Dr. Freiburger.  
Attorney De La Rosa informs the Court that he is giving consideration to pursuing a motion to dismiss Count #1.  Attorney De La Rosa requests that the Court await the report of Dr. Freiburger before any trial date is set.  
DA Happ has no objection to the case being set for another status conference. 
The Court indicates to counsel that they should be prepared, at the February 23rd hearing, to inform the Court of their decision about requesting any further examination. If there is no such request, the Court intends to discuss the scheduling of trial dates.
recess 9:19am. 

NEXT:  Status Conference on 2/23/17 at 3:00pm - send notices
That the COC prepare an order for NGI Exam consisitent w/the request
Status conference on January 12, 2017 at 09:00 am.

[MK] case called at 9:20am.
Defendant Trevor J Ahrens in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsel acknowledge receipt of Dr. Berney's Report.  DA Happ indicates that she has questions regarding Dr. Berney's findings; she proposes that the Court schedule an evidentiary hearing for Dr. Berney to testify in person and elaborate on his findings. 
After a discussion between the Court and counsel regarding whether there is any authority for the scheduling of such a hearing, DA Happ then requests the scheduling of a second examination, proposing the appointment of Dr. James Freiburger as the examiner. 
After further discussion, and on agreement of counsel, the Court indicates that it will not act on the State's request for Dr. Freiburger to be appointed at this time.  Instead counsel will discuss the findings of Dr. Berney with him further.   The Court schedules the case for a Status Conference in January, indicating that if the State does decide to pursue having a second examination completed, they are to notify the Court of this by letter and the Court intends to grant the request at that time.  The Court clarifies that the State should make such a request by letter once a decision is made, and not await the January status date before making a request.  
recess 9:32am. 

NEXT:  Status Conference on January 12th at 9:00am--send notices

Case called at 1:03 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Trevor J Ahrens in court, in-custody, with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim Rights Compliance Verified; Court so finds
Court inquires of parties if they received updated report as there is not one in the Court file, Atty De La Rosa provides his original, Clerk makes copy for the Court and returns original to Atty De La Rosa
Atty De La Rosa informs the Court that he received copy of report on Friday from Dr. Schoenecker, are requesting a brief adjournment of 30 - 35 minutes so can further review report with Mr. Ahrens
ADA Teuber informs the Court that the State also received a copy of the report, do have Dr. Schoenecker available to testify, but unsure if he'll be available in 30 -35 minutes as requested
Court informs parties that State can contact Dr. Schoenecker to check his availability and will recess at this time, plan to recall the case at 1:45 pm. If Dr. Schoenecker is not available for testimony, then the State shall notify the Court, so case may be called earlier.
Recess: 1:08 pm Reconvene: 1:44 pm  - Appearances are the same
ADA Teuber waives right to present further evidence and informs the Court that counsel agree that the report is admissible
Mr. Ahrens informs the Court that he believes that he is incompetent
Atty De La Rosa preserves defense right to present evidence

Dr. Craig Schoenecker--sworn & testifies
--direct exam by ADA Teuber
--cross exam by Atty De La Rosa

Trevor J. Ahrens--sworn & testifies
--direct exam by Atty De La Rosa
Evidence Closed; Court concludes that the State has proved by clear and convincing evidence that Mr. Ahrens is competent to proceed, presents basis
Atty De La Rosa requests that the matter be set for preliminary hearing

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Competency hearing on June 7, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Case called at 1:39pm [mo]
Defendant Trevor J Ahrens in court, in custody with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Counsel verifies receipt of report of examiner.
Counsel waives the right to produce further evidence

Mr. Ahrens indicates that he believes that he IS NOT competent
The Court finds Mr. Ahrens to be NOT competent, but likely to become competent

The Court makes an order of commitment pending the Defendant becoming competent
The Court finds that there is NOT a basis to order involuntarily medication.

Upon stipulation of the Parties, The Court finds that the Defendant has 53 days of pre commitment credit.

The Court orders that the proceedings are suspended.

recess: 1:49pm

NEXT: Competency Hearing on 6/7/16 at 1:00pm

Case called at 1:44pm [mo]
[Commissioner Weber presiding for Branch II Intake]
Defendant Trevor J Ahrens appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa(PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Court verifies date of birth and address on Criminal Complaint

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $50,000 CASH bond, with conditions:
--No Contact with M.M.H. (dob 5/20/1980)
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession of dangerous weapons
--comply with any recommendations of his case manager through Jefferson County Human Services

Atty. De La Rosa raises competency of Mr. Ahrens

The Court will accept the stipulation of the parties, that it is probable that the Defendant commited the acts charged, this finding can be based upon the complaint and the stipulation of parties
The Court will order the Defendant to be examined by the Department, the Department is to determine who will conduct the examination and whether is will be conducted on an inpatient or out patient basis. 
If the examination is conducted in patient, the report shall be completed and filed within 15 days after examination

Atty. De La Rosa requests that the Competency Hearing be scheduled 45 days out. 
recess 2:02 pm. 


NEXT: Competency Hearing on 4/1/2016 at 1:30pm
